user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_TaskEntryPoint:
```c
void OS_TaskEntryPoint(osal_id_t task_id)
{
    osal_task_entry task_entry;

    if (OS_TaskPrepare(task_id, &task_entry) == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        if (task_entry != NULL)
        {
            (*task_entry)();
        }
    }

    /* If the function returns, treat as a normal exit and do the proper cleanup */
    OS_TaskExit();
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
OS_TaskExit();
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated. OS_TaskExit() is reachable: it executes when OS_TaskPrepare() fails, when task_entry is NULL, or when the called task_entry() returns normally. Therefore the call is not statically unreachable.
